missionProperties.startingObjective: Get into the compound. Optional: Activate <color="red">C-3PO</color>.
missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a deactivated <color="red">C-3PO</color> to make him operational. While <color="red">C-3PO</color> is operational, he is a Rebel figure and heroes control him as an ally. If <color="red">C-3PO</color> is defeated, his figure remains on the map. Do not mark him as defeated. He discards all conditions and damage tokens and becomes deactivated.
{-} An Imperial figure can interact with a terminal to increase {D} by 1 when instructed. (When that happens, click the terminal and select "Increase {D}".) Limit once per terminal per round.
{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack doors and terminals (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}). C-3PO can interact with a door or terminal to open that door or discard that terminal.
{-} The mission will progress when a door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 2
globalEvents.eventText:

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.eventText:

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
You press forward into the back alleys of Mos Eisley. You try to stay alert since there are so many things to keep your eyes open for: the Imperial post, its guards, and C-3PO.

As you storm toward the hidden compound, you see the protocol droid’s limp form on the ground amidst a mass of trooper guards. You press forward into the fray, desperate to get through into the base, hoping it will hold answers about the local Imperial presence.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} The Rebel mission token is the deactivated <color="red">C-3PO</color>.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a deactivated <color="red">C-3PO</color> to make him operational. While <color="red">C-3PO</color> is operational, he is a Rebel figure and heroes control him as an ally. If <color="red">C-3PO</color> is defeated, his figure remains on the map. Do not mark him as defeated. He discards all conditions and damage tokens and becomes deactivated.
{-} An Imperial figure can interact with a terminal to increase {D} by 1 when instructed. (When that happens, click the terminal and select "Increase {D}".) Limit once per terminal per round.
{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack doors and terminals (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}). C-3PO can interact with a door or terminal to open that door or discard that terminal.
{-} The mission will progress when a door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.theText: {-} Interact with an adjacent terminal. (Limit once per round per terminal.)

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
You bear down on the commander, but before you can detain him, troops encircle him and drag him to safety. You are then left free to ransack this Imperial post.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} If Biv Bodhrik is a hero, he gains the “Hunt Them Down” Reward card. Otherwise, heroes receive 150 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText: Did you play this mission as part of the "Twin Shadows" mini campaign?

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
The Imperial forces are too overwhelming. The stormtroopers and their powerful commander bear down on you, and you are forced to retreat.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.theText: Did you play this mission as part of the "Twin Shadows" mini campaign?

globalEvents.name: Campaign Win Yes
globalEvents.eventText:
“Found anything interesing?" your pilot asks over your comlink as you tear apart this small Imperial post. “Because we really need some information soon. I found out why we lost communication with this planet. It turns out there’ a Star Destroyer in orbit. I can’t even get any signal out of the planet’s atmosphere without it being intercepted and scrambled.”

With a renewed sense of urgency, you continue to search for answers. You find information on an Imperial commander named Somos and records of surveillance and intimidation operations in the area. Nothing you find provides clues as to the Empire’ purpose in these operations.

Finally, you find the schematics for another base. It seems the post you're ransacking is  not the main center of operations. You feel a great sense of foreboding as you realize the coordinates for the main base lie in the middle of the Jundland Wastes. You look up into Tatooine’s twin suns, fearing the journey ahead.

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Canyon Run”.

globalEvents.name: Campaign Defeat Yes
globalEvents.eventText:
Forced to retreat, you pick up the deactivated body of C-3PO and run from the battle. You return to your small base, but too late: the Imperials are already there and you can only hide as they dismantle your refuge.

As they begin to move out, your pilot comes in on your comlink: “I know we're working blind, but take the droids and follow those troopers. I just found out why we lost contact in the first place. A Star Destroyer in orbit over the planet is blocking all Rebel comm signals. I don’t know what else it’s up to, but Id rather we found out ourselves before it happens!”

You follow his suggestion and sneak after the troopers. Much to your dismay, they seem to be moving toward a base in the unforgiving Jundland Wastes.

{-} Each hero receives 2 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Canyon Run”.

globalEvents.name: Campaign No
globalEvents.eventText:
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Raider Ambush
globalEvents.eventText: Suddenly, shouts and roars are heard from the edge of town. Tusken Raiders storm in, wielding dangerous gaffi sticks.

globalEvents.name: Primary Function
globalEvents.eventText:
“Oh my! What's happened?” The protocol droid staggers, but quickly comes to his senses. “Thank goodness you're here! The commander is just inside; I have translated the passcodes if you need them. We must hurry before more of them arrive!”

{-} <color="red">C-3PO</color> becomes operational.
{-} While <color="red">C-3PO</color> is operational, he is a Rebel figure and heroes control him as an ally. If <color="red">C-3PO</color> is defeated, his figure remains on the map. Do not mark him as defeated. He discards all conditions and damage tokens and becomes deactivated.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with an deactivated <color="red">C-3PO</color> to make him operational.

entityProperties.name: Compound Door 1
entityProperties.theText:
A closed door leads into the compound.

{-} The door is locked. A Rebel figure can attack it (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}). <color="red">C-3PO</color> can interact with the door to open it.

eventActions.theText: Is Biv Bodhrik on the map?

globalEvents.name: The Commander - Biv Yes
globalEvents.eventText: “You!” Biv shouts and points at a well-decorated and battle-scarred stormtrooper. The vile Kayn Somos stands before you: the only stormtrooper Biv has ever failed to kill.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Apply additional health to <color="red">Kayn Somos</color> equal to 1 plus the threat level.
{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">Kayn Somos</color> is defeated.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a deactivated <color="red">C-3PO</color> to make him operational. While <color="red">C-3PO</color> is operational, he is a Rebel figure and heroes control him as an ally. If <color="red">C-3PO</color> is defeated, his figure remains on the map. Do not mark him as defeated. He discards all conditions and damage tokens and becomes deactivated.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack terminals (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}). <color="red">C-3PO</color> can interact with a door or terminal to open that door or discard that terminal.
{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">Kayn Somos</color> is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Increase Threat
globalEvents.eventText: The Imperials manage to get a call for help off.

globalEvents.name: Destroy Terminal 1
globalEvents.eventText: The comm station collapses in a shower of sparks.

globalEvents.name: Destroy Terminal 2
globalEvents.eventText: The comm station collapses in a shower of sparks.

globalEvents.name: The Commander - Biv No
globalEvents.eventText: As the door to the compound slips open, a huge Stormtrooper commander turns towards you. He calmly points at you. "Wipe them out."
